byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and MICHAEL CORKERY

abstract: Growing number of start-ups are borrowing technique used by large corporations, using arbitration clause to block employees from bringing legal challenges against them; case in point is attempt by WeWork employee Tara Zoumer to bring colleagues together for class action suit forcing start-up to pay overtime wages; effort was shut down because hiring contract requires resolution of disputes through arbitration rather than courts.

headline.print_headline: Start-Ups Turn to Arbitration in Workplace
headline.main: Start-Ups Embrace Arbitration to Settle Workplace Disputes

snippet: As new companies grow, they are relying on a tool used by big corporations to shield themselves from potentially expensive class-action court cases.
lead_paragraph: As new companies grow, they are relying on a tool used by big corporations to shield themselves from potentially expensive class-action court cases.
